superior.translation[0].definitions[0].d: better, more powerful, more effective etc than a similar person or thing, especially one that you are competing against
superior.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Fletcher’s superior technique brought him victory.
He loves making fun of women. It makes him feel superior.
a vastly superior (=very much better, stronger etc) army
Your computer is far superior to mine.
superior.translation[0].definitions[1].d: thinking that you are better than other people – used to show disapproval
superior.translation[0].definitions[1].e: She had that superior tone of voice.
superior.translation[0].definitions[2].d: having a higher position or rank than someone else
superior.translation[0].definitions[2].e: Don’t you usually salute a superior officer?
superior.translation[0].definitions[3].d: of very good quality – used especially in advertising
superior.translation[0].note_box[0].sect: They soon realized that the opposing team’s players were far superior to their own.
You’d be better off visiting the infinitely superior Imperial War Museum.
He believed that some races were inherently superior to others.
They also accuse Christians of pretending to be morally superior.
Our job is to convince consumers that our product is technically superior to its competitors.
Digital radios offer a superior quality of sound.
This boat meets the needs of serious yachtsmen who demand superior performance.
She was always showing off her superior knowledge.
He used his superior strength to wrestle Ben to the ground.
superior.translation[0].note_box[1].item: Something or someone is superior to another thing or person
We can’t say one language is superior to another
Superior already has ‘more’ as part of its meaning
superior.translation[1].definitions[0].d: someone who has a higher rank or position than you, especially in a job
superior.translation[1].definitions[0].e: He had a good working relationship with his immediate superior (=the person directly above him).
superior.translation[2].definitions[0].d: better in quality than other things of the same kind
superior.translation[2].definitions[0].e: The agency lets superior apartments and houses to international companies.
Its products are seen as superior to many models produced by its American rival.
superior.translation[2].definitions[1].d: having a higher position or rank than someone or something
superior.translation[2].definitions[1].e: Civil servants are accountable for their decisions either tosuperior officers or to the general public.
The case was filed in the Los Angelessuperior court.
superior.translation[3].definitions[0].d: someone with a higher position or rank than another person, especially in a job
superior.translation[3].definitions[0].e: Superiors sometimes find it difficult to delegate their authority.
You should communicate clearly both to subordinates  (=people of a lower position or rank) and your superiors.
